content:
You're doing great by being mindful of your snacking habits!

Granola bars and apple with peanut butter are decent snack options, but there are even healthier choices that can provide a nutritional boost. Here are some easy-to-prepare and pack snack options:

**Fresh Fruit**

* Fresh berries (strawberries, blueberries, grapes)
* Sliced apples or oranges
* Bananas
* Avocado slices (yes, they're a fruit too!)

**Nuts and Seeds**

* Almonds
* Walnuts
* Pumpkin seeds
* Chia seeds
* Trail mix with nuts and seeds (watch out for added sugars)

**Veggie Delights**

* Carrot sticks with hummus
* Cucumber slices with dill dip
* Cherry tomatoes with balsamic vinegar
* Roasted chickpeas seasoned with herbs and spices

**Protein-rich Snacks**

* Hard-boiled eggs
* Greek yogurt
* Cottage cheese
* Edamame
* Beef or turkey jerky (look for low-sodium options)

**Whole Grain Crackers and Spreads**

* Whole grain crackers with avocado spread
* Whole grain crackers with peanut butter or almond butter
* Whole grain crackers with hummus

**Homemade Snacks**

* Energy balls made with oats, nuts, and dried fruits
* Homemade granola with rolled oats, nuts, and seeds
* Cut veggies with homemade ranch or tzatziki sauce

Remember, portion control is key when it comes to snacking. Aim for snacks that are around 100-200 calories per serving.

You can also try to incorporate more protein and healthy fats into your snacks to keep you fuller for longer. Experiment with different options and find what works best for you!
